discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Whether controls are operating effectively

Technical metrics are quantitative data points that are used to measure specific aspects of information security controls, such as performance, efficiency, and reliability. They can be used to determine whether these controls are operating effectively by providing measurable evidence regarding their functioning.

A. Whether controls are operating effectively

Technical metrics are most commonly used to assess the performance and effectiveness of security controls and measures. These metrics provide quantitative data about the functioning of specific security mechanisms, such as firewalls, intrusion detection systems, antivirus software, and encryption tools. By analyzing technical metrics, organizations can evaluate the operational effectiveness of these controls, identify any issues or vulnerabilities, and make necessary adjustments to improve security.

Selected Answer: C
Including a right-to-audit clause in contracts with external cloud service providers allows the organization to conduct audits and assessments to verify compliance with security and risk management requirements. This clause provides the organization with the ability to monitor the provider's security controls, assess the effectiveness of risk management processes, and ensure that the cloud services meet the organization's security standards.

While options like the availability of continuous technical support (option A), appropriate service level agreements (SLAs) (option B), and having internal security standards in place (option D) are important considerations, the right-to-audit clause specifically empowers the organization to directly assess and monitor the security practices of the external cloud service provider.
